Message.Title: China's Alibaba to pass Amazon, eBay in transaction value
Message.Msg: (Reuters) - China's largest e-commerce firm, Alibaba Group, expects to sell merchandise this year worth more than that sold by Amazon Inc and eBay combined, Alibaba's chief strategy officer said on Saturday. The company is aiming for 3 trillion yuan ($473 billion) in annual transaction value from its Taobao e-commerce units in the next 5 to 7 years, Zeng Ming told reporters. "From their annual reports we did a rough calculation and we were similar last year but we are growing faster than them this year, so this year we are probably larger than them," Zeng said of Amazon and eBay, America's top online retailer and auction site. "The gap is just going to get bigger and bigger when we grow faster," he said.

Message.Title: AMZN worth $120BIL. YHOO owns a large portion of Alibaba that does more business, YHOO has $3BIL in cash
Message.Msg: AMZN has $1BIL when stripping out payment to suppliers. YHOO makes more money per share than AMZN. YHOO bought $1BIL of stock in the past 4 quarters. In 18 years they'll wipe out entire float. Ownership of Alibaba is an enormous value. I believe it is worth around $25BIL - $30BIL. This is what Daniel Loeb is looking at as well. Y Japan is worth about $4BIL. Yahoo has these investments on books at $5.8BIL and cannot revalue them using GAAP. If I was Marissa, I would spin off these investments into Yahoo Investments company as a tax free spinoff to shareholders and Yahoo. With this approach Yahoo would get to value the investments at closing value (FMV) and the share price would rise to $35 - $40. Alibaba will become a huge competitor for Amazon in a few years and I believe it will be a premier merchant globally. Yahoo will need to work with Facebook to monetize Alibaba in USA/World and work on Mobile advertising and search. Yahoo represents value while Amazon represents momo cr@p.

Message.Title: Pea Brain Stoneer said
Message.Msg: "Compared to newer powerhouse social and search giants in Silicon Valley, Yahoo seems faded and out of place,” Stone wrote. “The bold act of picking up and moving to New York City could cast Yahoo in the completely different light of a comparatively nascent and powerful player in the media capital of the world.” It is like saying all major tech companies can't compete against Google, should just fold and go into other businesses that it hasn't mastered, like Media, or farming, or food distribution or anything else?! What have they done that qualify them to advise Yahoo on corporate strategy? What Marissa is going to relocate over 50% of the employees to NYC - one of the most expensive places to rent and hire employees and pay $100k/family moving cost for 5,000 families? Marissa will make her husband move to NYC just becuz Stoner said Marissa can attend board meetings for the museum and ballet company??? LAME BRAIN !!! What all the media behemoths just going to let Yahoo run the media show because it cant beat Google and it has Broadway and Madison Avenue aspiration??? More like "THE STUPID SUGGESTION of picking up and moving to NYC could doom Yahoo in the complete different Challenges FOR a comparatively nascent, UNFAMILIAR and WEAK player in the media capital of the world "

Topic.Title: Alibaba's transaction Value more than AMZN & EBAY

Message.Msg: You can get out of most conditional contracts. There are always clause pending market condition changes, both parties financial and operation changes, and valuation changes which negated certain undefined or unforeseened issues. In this case, was Jack Ma truthful about the true sales and profit figures? Yahoo could easily cite previous issues like AliPay and other past indisgression on the part of Alibaba management as need for verification for true sales figure and operation expenses to VERIFY the valuation of Alibaba. I just heard Ma crapped in his pants. I don't know why the greedy pig is not hurry up and transferred the cash into Yahoo escrow acct.

Topic.Title: Yahoo to keep Right Media, passes on potential $1B payout

Message.Msg: In 2007 Yahoo bought Right Media for $850 million. Early in 2012 Yahoo put out feelers trying to sell Right Media for $1 billion. Apparently there was some interest but apparently not enough for an offer close to what Yahoo wanted and in September Yahoo took Right Media off the market. Imagined value and sticker price don´t always fly in the real world. And since this is Yahoo you can expect; In 2014 Yahoo sold Right Media for $75 million.
